name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Waco North

reviews.text: My husband, myself, and our two daughters stayed at this hotel for one night. From walking into the lobby, you could tell that the hotel was relatively new. It still had the smell and everything looked new and shinny. The lobby staff were young and not professional though. One girl seemed not to know what she was doing (maybe she is new also). Our room was very clean and well decorated. Although the pillows looked dwarfed on the bed. My husband had to ask for another one. The amenities are great:big tv, DVD, FREE INTERNET!, iron, fridg, microwave, coffee maker, hairdryer, ect. My daughter loved the alarm clock because it played CD's and she woke up with her favorite song playing. The free continental breakfast was better than your run of the mill but my husband complained that the danish was hard. You can make your own waffles from scratch! I would stay away from the coffee though. Tasted stale to me. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again. I think what we paid was a bit too much but I am a cheap person and if I would have booked earlier probably could have got it cheaper.
reviews.title: Nice middle class hotel.
Great hotel
reviews.text: I stayed for a week at the Fairfield Inn & Suites North in Waco and was very pleased. Very nice rooms with a microwave, refrigerator and DVD player. Good size desk to do work and a reliable free internet connection. The hotel also includes a business center with printers. Other perks include an indoor pool and complimentary continental breakfast. Overall a very good experience.

reviews.title: Wonderful Acommodations
reviews.text: I recently stayed with the Fairfield Inn & Suites Waco North and it was a delightful experience. The staff were extremely friendly and I felt as if I were right at home! I am a frequent business traveler and this is by far the nicest hotel in Waco!

reviews.title: GREAT STAY!
reviews.text: My friends and I stayed in Waco to attend a Texas A&M Game. We needed a place to accomodate 6 people and Waco was the closest vacancy. This hotel was GREAT! It was very clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms have everything you could possibly need on a vacation. There are 2 media centers that include CD/DVD/STEREO and a large T.V.. The microwave and mini-fridge were a plus too. I will recommend this hotel to anyone who is traveling to or through Waco. We loved it! From now on, we always look for a Fairfield Inn and Suites anythime we travel.

reviews.title: UNFairfield Inns and Suites Waco
reviews.text: My wife and I were in Waco, TX @ the Fairfield Inn June 2-3 of 2004 for a Shriner competition. When we checked out we left the room keys in the room and left the hotel. My credit card was billed for four nights instead of the two that we stayed there. When I contacted the hotel the GM was unwilling to refund our money being that it was "Our word against their's." Unfortunately our credit card company feels there is no proof either way. The Hotel has great rooms and a very poor staff. We are very unsatisfied with this Property...Cody

Very nice, clean hotel, non-smoking, very friendly staff. Right nesxt to Hampton inn that other posts reported smoking smells. Also next to Cracker Baarrel, Starbucks and Quizno's, all walking distance. Room was very nice, huge bathroom wih big jacuzzi tub, and wood blinds to keep an eye on your kids, I guess. Indoor pool, very nice, great breakfast, make your own waffles. Definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — no door separating bedroom from living area(toddler sleeping on foldout bed)

reviews.text: We just got back from staying at the Fairfield inn & Suites. It was very clean and the staff was friendly. Traveling with children makes you very aware of how clean a hotel is and I will pick this hotel again if I ever need to stay in Waco. It's also walking distance (one hotel away) from the Cracker Barrell (great home cooking). That was a perk! The room and the bathroom was extremely clean. The shower was large with a big shower head (enjoyable). We liked the indoor pool because I didn't have to worry about sunscreen or sunburns with my 2 1/2 year old. Breakfast was really good too.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Clean. White bedcovers, nice desk with wireless in room, big flat screen TV in room. Nice indoor pool with hot tub.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: A clean room, good staff, convenient to the interstate, nice pool, good breakfast. What's not to like??
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: We had a clean and quiet room at a reasonable price, a good breakfast and easy access to the highway. Fairfield did it right.
reviews.title: Decent value

description: Welcome to the Fairfield-Inn & Suites Waco-North, a newly-remodeled Waco, Texas-hotel. Whether you're visiting for business/leisure, it will be a pleasure to introduce you to our special-brand of lodging. It all begins with friendly, personal-service and continues with spacious, well-appointed guest-rooms and comforting-amenities. Enjoy a stellar-location that puts the Waco-Regional-Airport, Baylor University, great-restaurants and dozens of Texas-attractions at your fingertips. Experience a great-deal more of Waco for a great-deal-one of our value hotel-specials and packages.
